page.title: 07WILCOX AND SONS 2
page.content: The firm has been in Holme Lacy for 7 years, but Mr Wilcox has had it for 15 years. He has{12 workers}now, but he had 25 before he bought his modern {machinery,}which is{all British. When he had the old machines, he employed people from the village, but he says they were not able to pick up the skills to use the new machines, so his workers mostly come from{Hereford. }This is a pity, as it means the only firm in the village cannot provide work for the people who live there. The machinery he has got is worth Â£500,000. The work they do is so precise, because so many of the machines are computer-driven, and his prices are so reasonable, that he gets a lot of{work {from all over the country.
